messages.message:
on aihub-uat.internal, the document renderer seems to be adjusting my documents weirdly [justify-left / justify-right, but not justify-center].  I think that it might actually be cropping off some content of the document as well.  I tried zooming out and zooming in as well to see if the reset happened, but that doesn’t seem to help.

Attaching the document in case folks want to reproduce.

i think the issue is that we center the images based on the widest page image

starting at page 75 (which says page 73 in the document footer), the page images are a lot wider
btw you’ll see this same behavior on ML Studio and Reader as well
Ooo I see.  Thanks for clarifying.  Is this something that we plan to adjust in the future?

we haven’t prioritized this so far!

fyi this may be more of an issue on mobile @Liam Callanan
I actually tested this on my 30" monitor :grimacing:

oh yes ofc! i was saying that the discrepancy in the apparent image alignment will be an even bigger issue on mobile vs on desktop

your desktop screen is big enough that you can see at least part of the page and realize you can scroll, but on mobile, users may just see a gray background and may not realize they can scroll
